title: 2025 Super Bowl Commercials: All the Touchdowns, Field Goals and Fumbles
description: One needn’t know the difference between a touchdown and a turnover to enjoy the Super Bowl. For many viewers (and we suspect many a TVLine reader), it’s all about the commercials. Each year, advertisers pony up big bucks to wave their wares in front of more than 100 million viewers (even though most ads are now […]
author: Ryan Schwartz
excerpt: All the best Super Bowl commercials are released ahead of kickoff. See which famous faces were drafted to shill, and who scored the biggest laughs.
text: One needn’t know the difference between a touchdown and a turnover to enjoy the Super Bowl. For many viewers (and we suspect many a TVLine reader), it’s all about the commercials. Each year, advertisers pony up big bucks to wave their wares in front of more than 100 million viewers (even though most ads are now released online, ahead of the Big Game). So, who drafted famous faces to shill? And who among them delivered the biggest laughs? Below you’ll find a curated selection of star-studded commercials that everyone will be talking about for the next 24-48 hours, featuring such familiar faces as Adam Brody, Barry Keoghan, Billy Crystal, Channing Tatum, Charli XCX, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Pratt, David Beckham, Eugene Levy, Kevin Bacon, Ludacris, Martha Stewart, Matt Damon, Matthew McConaughey, Meg Ryan, Nick Offerman, Sydney Sweeney, Vin Diesel and Walton Goggins. Keep scrolling to review 20 of the best and worst Game Day commercials released ahead of kickoff — which we’ve playfully categorized as Touchdowns, Field Goals and Fumbles — then hit the comments with your reviews. 🏈 TOUCHDOWNS BudweiserThe Budweiser Clydesdale makes its record-setting 47th (!) appearance during the biggest sporting event of the year. GoDaddy (featuring Walton Goggins)The Justified star reveals that he never really knows what he’s doing — whether he’s on a soundstage or in his garage, trying to get a small business off the ground. (Try saying “Walton Goggins’ Goggle Glasses” three times fast. We dare you.) Häagen-Dazs (featuring Vin Diesel, Ludacris & Michelle Rodriguez)Dominic Toretto and Letty Ortiz slow down to savor the moment — and a delicious vanilla milk chocolate almond bar — much to Tej’s dismay. They’re not so fast and furious now! Hellmann’s (featuring Billy Crystal, Meg Ryan & Sydney Sweeney)Thirty-five years after Sally faked an orgasm at Katz’s Deli, she causes yet another stir. Only this time, she’s not faking it. “This one’s real,” Harry confirms. Instacart (featuring Isaiah Mustafa)The delivery company assembles the Avengers of mascots — including Mr. Clean, The Energizer Bunny, The Green Giant, The Man Your Man Could Smell Like and the Kool-Aid Man — for their first-ever Game Day ad. (Can we get an “Oh, yeah!”?) Little Caesars Pizza (featuring Eugene & Sarah Levy)The irresistible flavor of Crazy Puffs causes Levy’s iconic eyebrows to comically disappear. Pringles (featuring Adam Brody, Nick Offerman, James Harden & Andy Reid)In his effort to procure more Pringles, Brody unknowingly summons the mustaches of several facial-haired legends. Sketchers (featuring Andy Reid)The Kansas City Chiefs coach is two-for-two. Here he follows in the footsteps of George Costanza with the reveal of his new “side hustle.” Squarespace (featuring Barry Keoghan)Barry Keoghan rides another jackass in this send-up of 2023 Best Picture nominee The Banshees of Inisherin. Stella Artois (featuring Matt Damon and David Beckham)Damon and Beckham fully commit to the bit, with Damon cast as Beckham’s long-lost, American twin brother Dave. Stōk Cold Brew (featuring Channing Tatum)The Gambit to Ryan Reynolds’ Deadpool steps up in a big way and gets the entire Wrexham AFC locker room up on its feet to master a new celebration dance. Totino’s Pizza Rolls (featuring Tim Robinson & Sam Richardson)This one’s for all the Detroiters fans out there. Or anyone who has ever wondered how I Think You Should Leave would tackle an E.T. parody. Uber Eats (featuring Matthew McConaughey, Charli XCX, Greta Gerwig, Kevin Bacon, Martha Stewart & Sean Evans)What if the very invention of football was all one giant conspiracy to make us hungry? That’s McConaughey’s pitch to Gerwig, as he attempts to woo the Barbie director to helm his next feature film. 🏈 FIELD GOALS Booking.com (featuring the Muppets)Can someone please come up with a decent show for Jim Henson’s most beloved creations? HexClad (featuring Gordon Ramsay & Pete Davidson)Ramsay is recruited by alien ambassador Pete Davidson to cook for all the foodies inhabiting Area 51. “You’re an alien?” he asks the SNL alum. “All famous people are aliens,” Davidson answers. Well, all the really famous people. Meta Ray-Ban (featuring Chris Hemsworth, Chris Pratt & Kris Jenner)Are two Chrises better than one? What about two Chrises and a Kris? Here, a pair of Marvel superheroes shill for A.I. glasses with an assist from the Kardashian matriarch. Michelob Ultra (featuring Willem Dafoe & Catherine O’Hara) Dafoe and O’Hara engage NFL legend Randy Moss, Olympic gold medalist Ryan Crouser and WNBA champion Sabrina Ionescu in a little friendly competition. Oikos (featuring Juno Temple)The Ted Lasso star makes herself big and carries pro footballer Myles Garrett across an airport. (On a related note: Anyone else suddenly feel the urge to invade France?) 🏈 FUMBLES Coffee-Mate (featuring Shania Twain)We could have gone our entire lives without seeing the Queen of Country Pop voice a sentient tongue. Mountain Dew (featuring SEAL & Becky G)We also could have gone our entire lives without seeing SEAL’s face superimposed on an actual seal’s body. But props to the Grammy winner for not taking himself too seriously. What was your favorite (and least favorite) Super Bowl commercial this year? Leave a comment and let us know.
html:
One needn’t know the difference between a touchdown and a turnover to enjoy the Super Bowl. For many viewers (and we suspect many a TVLine reader), it’s all about the commercials.

Each year, advertisers pony up big bucks to wave their wares in front of more than 100 million viewers (even though most ads are now released online, ahead of the Big Game). So, who drafted famous faces to shill? And who among them delivered the biggest laughs?

Below you’ll find a curated selection of star-studded commercials that everyone will be talking about for the next 24-48 hours, featuring such familiar faces as Adam Brody, Barry Keoghan, Billy Crystal, Channing Tatum, Charli XCX, Chris Hemsworth, Chris Pratt, David Beckham, Eugene Levy, Kevin Bacon, Ludacris, Martha Stewart, Matt Damon, Matthew McConaughey, Meg Ryan, Nick Offerman, Sydney Sweeney, Vin Diesel and Walton Goggins.

Keep scrolling to review 20 of the best and worst Game Day commercials released ahead of kickoff — which we’ve playfully categorized as Touchdowns, Field Goals and Fumbles — then hit the comments with your reviews.

🏈 TOUCHDOWNS

Budweiser
The Budweiser Clydesdale makes its record-setting 47th (!) appearance during the biggest sporting event of the year.

GoDaddy (featuring Walton Goggins)
The Justified star reveals that he never really knows what he’s doing — whether he’s on a soundstage or in his garage, trying to get a small business off the ground. (Try saying “Walton Goggins’ Goggle Glasses” three times fast. We dare you.)

Häagen-Dazs (featuring Vin Diesel, Ludacris & Michelle Rodriguez)
Dominic Toretto and Letty Ortiz slow down to savor the moment — and a delicious vanilla milk chocolate almond bar — much to Tej’s dismay. They’re not so fast and furious now!

Hellmann’s (featuring Billy Crystal, Meg Ryan & Sydney Sweeney)
Thirty-five years after Sally faked an orgasm at Katz’s Deli, she causes yet another stir. Only this time, she’s not faking it. “This one’s real,” Harry confirms.

Instacart (featuring Isaiah Mustafa)
The delivery company assembles the Avengers of mascots — including Mr. Clean, The Energizer Bunny, The Green Giant, The Man Your Man Could Smell Like and the Kool-Aid Man — for their first-ever Game Day ad. (Can we get an “Oh, yeah!”?)

Little Caesars Pizza (featuring Eugene & Sarah Levy)
The irresistible flavor of Crazy Puffs causes Levy’s iconic eyebrows to comically disappear.

Pringles (featuring Adam Brody, Nick Offerman, James Harden & Andy Reid)
In his effort to procure more Pringles, Brody unknowingly summons the mustaches of several facial-haired legends.

Sketchers (featuring Andy Reid)
The Kansas City Chiefs coach is two-for-two. Here he follows in the footsteps of George Costanza with the reveal of his new “side hustle.”

Squarespace (featuring Barry Keoghan)
Barry Keoghan rides another jackass in this send-up of 2023 Best Picture nominee The Banshees of Inisherin.

Stella Artois (featuring Matt Damon and David Beckham)
Damon and Beckham fully commit to the bit, with Damon cast as Beckham’s long-lost, American twin brother Dave.

Stōk Cold Brew (featuring Channing Tatum)
The Gambit to Ryan Reynolds’ Deadpool steps up in a big way and gets the entire Wrexham AFC locker room up on its feet to master a new celebration dance.

Totino’s Pizza Rolls (featuring Tim Robinson & Sam Richardson)
This one’s for all the Detroiters fans out there. Or anyone who has ever wondered how I Think You Should Leave would tackle an E.T. parody.

Uber Eats (featuring Matthew McConaughey, Charli XCX, Greta Gerwig, Kevin Bacon, Martha Stewart & Sean Evans)
What if the very invention of football was all one giant conspiracy to make us hungry? That’s McConaughey’s pitch to Gerwig, as he attempts to woo the Barbie director to helm his next feature film.

🏈 FIELD GOALS

Booking.com (featuring the Muppets)
Can someone please come up with a decent show for Jim Henson’s most beloved creations?

HexClad (featuring Gordon Ramsay & Pete Davidson)
Ramsay is recruited by alien ambassador Pete Davidson to cook for all the foodies inhabiting Area 51. “You’re an alien?” he asks the SNL alum. “All famous people are aliens,” Davidson answers. Well, all the really famous people.

Meta Ray-Ban (featuring Chris Hemsworth, Chris Pratt & Kris Jenner)
Are two Chrises better than one? What about two Chrises and a Kris? Here, a pair of Marvel superheroes shill for A.I. glasses with an assist from the Kardashian matriarch.

Michelob Ultra (featuring Willem Dafoe & Catherine O’Hara) 
Dafoe and O’Hara engage NFL legend Randy Moss, Olympic gold medalist Ryan Crouser and WNBA champion Sabrina Ionescu in a little friendly competition.

Oikos (featuring Juno Temple)
The Ted Lasso star makes herself big and carries pro footballer Myles Garrett across an airport. (On a related note: Anyone else suddenly feel the urge to invade France?)

🏈 FUMBLES

Coffee-Mate (featuring Shania Twain)
We could have gone our entire lives without seeing the Queen of Country Pop voice a sentient tongue.

Mountain Dew (featuring SEAL & Becky G)
We also could have gone our entire lives without seeing SEAL’s face superimposed on an actual seal’s body. But props to the Grammy winner for not taking himself too seriously.

What was your favorite (and least favorite) Super Bowl commercial this year? Leave a comment and let us know.
